title: Hospitals to have special wards for elderly: Kaul
text:
Tribune News Service
Mandi, October 19
The state government has decided to set up special wards for old-age people in hospitals. This was stated by Health and Revenue Minister Kaul Singh Thakur after laying the foundation stone of an ayurveda health centre at Hurang village under Kathog panchayat in the district today. “The facility has already been started in Chamba, Kinnaur and Lahaul-Spiti,” he said. Under the Chief Minister Healthcare scheme, special arrangements had been made for the people above 80 years and single woman. These people, who were not covered under the National Health Insurance and other health schemes, would be benefited, he said. The minister said the test facility for blood sugar had been provided at the sub-health centre level in the state. Apart from this, mobile health teams were being constituted to get information about health-related problems in children from schools, he said, adding that after the detection of a disease, the child would be treated free at government or empanelled hospitals. The minister said the government would provide better health facilities in the remote and tribal areas and Rs 1,478 crore had been earmarked for health and education in the current financial year. To provide better health facilities in the Drang Assembly constituency, Rs 6.50 crore would be spent, he said, adding that Rs 5.50 crore had been sanctioned for the Civil Hospital at Padhar.
